channel.title: Hello, world! on Janine Cheong
channel.description: Recent content in Hello, world! on Janine Cheong

item.title: Major Project # 1: Predicting Top 50 S&P 500 Stock Market Prices
item.description: Forecasting can be defined as the prediction of some future event by analyzing historical data. This project aims to predict the closing stock price of Top 50 S&P 500 companies using the past 60-day stock price and comparing the results using different ML/DL models. Moreover, the aim of the project is to provide support for beginners as a general guide on the price predictions. It also aims to identify application opportunities of machine learning in the stock market - bridging whether the technical analysis follows the model used.

item.title: Major Project # 2: Analyzing World Happiness Report 2019
item.description: The World Happiness Report measures the overall state of global happiness by factoring in each country’s status in economy, health, social support, government trust, etc. and ranks the countries by how happy their citizens perceive themselves to be. Since it covers different factors, it can be a useful guide to measure policy effectiveness and good governance and assess the quality of life among countries. Proponents of the project are Janine Cheong, Raymund Norada, Karen Salas, and Maico Rebong.

item.title: Project # 1: Exploring the Bitcoin Cryptocurrency Market
item.description: Cryptocurrency, especially Bitcoin, has been a buzz word lately. With a lot more people being exposed to trading, cyptocurrencies has been a strong contender for people and company investments. In this project, we will be using different data importing and cleaning, data manipulation, and data visualization techniques from basic Python to explore the Bitcoin Cryptocurrency Market. This project is created through the DataCamp guided projects. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project # 2: Predicting Credit Card Approvals
item.description: Commercial banks receive a lot of applications for credit cards. Many of them get rejected for many reasons, like high loan balances, low income levels, or too many inquiries on an individual’s credit report, for example. Manually analyzing these applications is mundane, error-prone, and time-consuming (and time is money!). Luckily, this task can be automated with the power of machine learning and pretty much every commercial bank does so nowadays. In this notebook, we will build an automatic credit card approval predictor using machine learning techniques, just like the real banks do.

item.title: Project # 3: Analyze International Debt Statistics using SQL
item.description: It’s not that we humans only take debts to manage our necessities. A country may also take debt to manage its economy. For example, infrastructure spending is one costly ingredient required for a country’s citizens to lead comfortable lives. The World Bank is the organization that provides debt to countries. In this notebook, we are going to analyze international debt data collected by The World Bank. The dataset contains information about the amount of debt (in USD) owed by developing countries across several categories.
